info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:01PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR EDGECOMBE AND EASTERN HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 600 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tarboro to 8 miles west of Bethel, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Tarboro, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Enfield, Princeville, Weldon, Pinetops, Macclesfield, Hobgood and Conetoe. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
